file_content.text: It doesn't make up for Uphrades, but score one for the Republic.
I have some frustrations I'd like to take out on these Imperials.
No sign of Darth Angral, but Uphrades... I saw this planet once, with Master Kiwiiks. It used to be green.
Sensors detect minimal life signs // Uphrades = dead world
General, I've arrived at Uphrades. There's no sign of Angral, but the planet... see for yourself.
Receiving your sensor readings. Stand by....
Uphrades's atmosphere looks like it's on fire. What could have done that?
Damage consistent with the designs recovered on Ord Mantell. The Desolator weapon.
Angral's taken the Planet Prison and turned it into something horrific.
The Sith has a world-killer.
The Desolator borrows technology from all our advanced warfare projects. Angral's son was quite the genius.
If Darth Angral has a weapon that can do this, the Republic is doomed.
We're in terrible danger.
There's virtually no vegetation left. Even the oceans are boiling.
How many millions are dead because you let the Sith steal your secret weapon?
It's all your fault, General.
Uphrades had millions of citizens... whole continents of farmlands.
All that life extinguished. The scale of this... it's unthinkable.
Getting an emergency transmission. It's faint--coming from the far side of the planet....
Republic vessel, do you copy? This is medical frigate Daybreaker. We're under attack!
Imperial commandos have boarded us. Help!
That's one of ours. The crew may know what happened here.
No more of our people die today. Kira, plot an intercept course.
I'll save them.
Angral doesn't want any witnesses.
No wonder they're under siege.
We should focus on Angral, not his commandos.
So what?
That ship may have sensor readings of the Desolator. Invaluable data.
The fleet won't get here in time. You need to save that ship. Hurry!
Kira, lay in a course for that ship.
We're on it.
Already done, Master.
Let's hope we can get there in time.
Here goes nothing.
If nothing else, we'll make those Imperials pay for what happened here.
If you insist.
Plotting an intercept course now.
Strap yourselves in....
Wouldn't it be great if the general called us to say good morning--just once? But no, it's always the end of the galaxy....
